titleStmt.title: Unknown et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9401

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency B Magoffin Governer of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that at the last Feby term 1861 of the Campbell Circuit Court George Knarr was convicted of killing one Mike Hitzman in a sudden quarrel arrising out of statements made by Hitzman impeaching the chastity of Knorrs wife,
They represent that Knorr is a good industrious citizen never accused of any offense except the above unfortuname affair;

He has a wife and one child dependent on him for their living and who are now in great want from being deprived of his care protection and assistance, The undersigned truly believe that the ends of just do not require his longer confinement in the penitentiary,
Wherefore Your petitioners ^pray^ Your Excellency to pardon and restore him to his family and liberty --

S. G
G Fischers
Joseph Mompser
Daniel Engleder
T B.
C. Sandel
Peter haugh hawk
Conrad Parr
Jonathan Horsfall Jailor
